title: Thermodynamics - Internal energy from PV graph

content.description: A monatomic ideal gas in a sealed container is taken from State <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi></math> to State <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> through intermediate states <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi> </math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, as shown in the <math alttext="P V" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>P</mi><mi>V</mi></math> diagram.
content.question: In which state, if any, is the internal energy of the gas equal to the internal energy of the gas in State <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>?

choices.label: No other state, because all of the other states have different pressures and/or volumes
